posts.post_content:
You know, a few of you think it's great for taking out blightsteel. It isn't. Blightsteel is indestructible.  
  
@ stille\_nacht: black has always had life-gain in the form of vampires haven't they? Blood-sucking creatures are part of blacks domain.  
  
I have to say, this card doesn't make sense flavour wise. Lands, ok, that's a bit of a stretch depending on the land. Planeswalkers (except Karn) make sense because they're already biological. But enchantments? Artifacts? That makes no sense.  
  
Know what'd be awesome tho? Make a huge (or infinite) 1/1 army. Use beast within and some duplicate combo to turn it into a 3/3 beast army. Precursor Golem and Xenograft would do, although there's bound to be another, better way to do it.

posts.post_content:
Even if you shouldn't find a nice target on your opponent's side to use this on *(which is very unlikely, unless your opponent has only some harmless little chump blockers or a lot of stuff with shroud or hexproof)*, you could always use it on your side if you can make better use of it.  
Especially if you have something like [Hatching Plans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hatching Plans). Or simply a spare land (which might be the case in the late game).

posts.post_content:
This New Phyrexia is somewhat inspired in Alien, isn't it?   
  
Well, this spell is sooooo sweet for every green player. Not to mention that a color with less answers for enemy creatures got solid creature removal, it's not restricted to creatures, it can hit everything on the board... even at instant speed. Putting 3/3 is not so problematic, it's still much more easy to handle 3/3 token than let's say Walletslayer, Jace, etc... Green is going to be funny.
posts.html:

Posted By: Amnatto (5/2/2011 5:10:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I dig having a new way to kill planeswalker.. but I don't so much dig giving them a 3/3 beast. Yes, I'll play it, because how many 3 mana answers to a pw are there in standard? However, it's not really card advantage.. you're just choosing between the lesser of 2 evils. Do I give them more creatures.. or let them abuse a planeswalker.. and of course normally you will choose the beasty. Consider though, that they will get the first turn use of their planeswalker to draw cards, make their own beasties, kill something, etc, and then you give them another beast on top of it to kill it. It's kind of like saying, your opponent made you discard, draw a card or etc, and put a beast into play. At that point your opponent is still ahead, just.. without their pw.
  
   
The art and flavor reminds me of the ghost busters movie where they turn into those demon dogs. :)

The flavor's all that's keeping [Pongify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pongify) ahead of this on my list of favorite removal spells.
